TextView.android:text:
Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering is a specialized branch of Electrical and Electronics Engineering and it deals with measurement, control and automation of processes. Apart from covering course subjects such as industrial instrumentation, Process control, Biomedical instrumentation, this branch also covers software and hardware subjects which are learnt by electronics and communication students. This makes an Instrumentation engineer fit for both software and hardware industries. Hence “Instrumentation Technology” has now been renamed as “Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering”.
The department of Instrumentation Technology was started in the year 1982 with the intake of 40 with clear vision to meet the challenges of the society of this region. The intake is enhanced to 60 from the academic year 2017-18. The department also running a PG course in Biomedical Electronics and Industrial Instrumentation. The department has been identified as research center by VTU Belagavi. Eleven candidates are pursuing PhD in the department. The department has highly skilled and qualified staff and has good infrastructure with well equipped laboratories. The department has been organizing several Faculty Development Programs, National seminars, Workshops etc. Recently the department has organized an International Conference on 'Current Research and Applications in Electrical Science' (ICCRAES-2016) on Oct 4th and 5th-2016. It has been tradition of the department to fetch state level recognition from the organization like KSCST for the projects undertaken by the students.
The department is also conducting certified LabVIEW and PLC trainings which helps the placement of the students. The department also has MOUs to help in this regard. A large no. of alumni of this department have been placed in many industries, R and D laboratories, Software companies and premier institutions in India and abroad.
To be an institute of excellence in technical education and research to serve the needs of the industry and society at local and global levels.
To provide a high - quality educational experience of students with values and ethics that enables them to become leaders in their chosen professions.
To explore , create and develop innovations in engineering and science through research and development activities.
To provide beneficial service to the national and multinational industries and communities through educational,technical and professional activities.
To be excellent in imparting engineering education and research in the field of Electronics and Instrumentation to serve the needs of industry and society .

* To provide quality technical education in the field of Electronics and Instrumentation through well defined curriculum which enables students to develop innovations in engineering and science through research activities.
* To equip students with skills needed to succeed in industries,entrepreneurship and to perceive higher studies.
* To motivate students to engage in lifelong learning and contribute to the society while being committed to social and ethical development.

Department of Electronics and Instrumentation Engineeering offers 4 years BE course and the intake is 60. It offers two 2 years Post Graduation course and department has a VTU recognized research centre and offers Ph.D. program.
1. UG Program : Electronics and Instrumentation Engineeering

Start year: 1982
Duration: 4 years (Eight semesters with total 200 credits)
Degree awarded: Bachelor of Engineering.
2. PG Program: Biomedical Electronics and Industrial Instrumentation

Start year: 2005
Duration: 2 years (Four semesters with total 100 credits)
Degree awarded: Master of Technology.
PEO1. Graduates apply Electronics and Instrumentation knowledge in measurements , control,process automation and related professional career.
PEO2. Graduates exhibit technical skills and leadership qualities.
PEO3. Graduates pursue higher studies , entrepreneurship and be productive at the workplace.
PEO4. Graduates will inculcate Professionalism with communiucation skills and also social and ethical attitude through lifelong learning.
Engineering graguates will be abel to:
1. Engineering knowledge: Apply the knowledge of mathematics, science, engineering fundamentals, and an engineering specialization to the solution of complex engineering problems.

2. Problem analysis: Identify, formulate, review research literature, and analyze complex engineering problems reaching substantiated conclusions using first principles of mathematics, natural sciences, and engineering sciences.

3. Design/development of solutions: Design solutions for complex engineering problems and design system components or processes that meet the specified needs with appropriate consideration for the public health and safety, and the cultural, societal, and environmental considerations.

4. Conduct investigations of complex problems: Use research-based knowledge and research methods including design of experiments, analysis and interpretation of data, and synthesis of the information to provide valid conclusions

5. Modern tool usage: Create, select, and apply appropriate techniques, resources, and modern engineering and IT tools including prediction and modeling to complex engineering activities with an understanding of the limitations.

6. The engineer and society: Apply reasoning informed by the contextual knowledge to assess societal, health, safety, legal and cultural issues and the consequent responsibilities relevant to the professional engineering practice.

7. Environment and sustainability: Understand the impact of the professional engineering solutions in societal and environmental contexts, and demonstrate the knowledge of, and need for sustainable development.
8. Ethics: Apply ethical principles and commit to professional ethics and responsibilities and norms of the engineering practice.
9. Individual and team work: Function effectively as an individual, and as a member or leader in diverse teams, and in multidisciplinary settings.

10. Communication: Communicate effectively on complex engineering activities with the engineering community and with society at large, such as, being able to comprehend and write effective reports and design documentation, make effective presentations, and give and receive clear instructions.

11. Project management and finance: Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the engineering and management principles and apply these to one’s own work, as a member and leader in a team, to manage projects and in multidisciplinary environments.
12. Life-long learning: Recognize the need for, and have the preparation and ability to engage in independent and life-long learning in the broadest context of technological change.
PSO1: Apply the knowledge of Electronics and Instrumentation in industrial measurement ,control and automation .
PSO2. Impliment the principles of Signal Processing ,VLSI ,embedded systems and programming in identifing and solving real time engineering problems .
PSO3. Apply consepts of management in industries and be commited to social and ethical responsibilities.

For UG (BE): The student should have passed 2nd PUC / 12th standard or equivalent examination with English as one of the languages and obtained 45% of marks in aggregate in Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics.
=> Electronics and Instrumentation Syllabus(Click to Download)
Dr. Channappa Bhyri M.E(M and I), Ph.D.
P D A College of Engineering, Kalaburagi.

Dr. Channappa Bhyri is presently working as Professor and HOD in Electronics and Instrumentation Technlogy. He has completed BE (Instrumentation) from Gulbarga University, Kalaburagi in the year 1989, M.Tech (Measurement and Instrumentation) from University of Roorkee, Roorkee in the year 1998 and then Ph.D. from Swami Ramanand Teerth Marathwada University, Nanded in the year 2014 under the faculty of Instrumentation.His research topic is, “Use of Disease Coding and Scoring Patterns for Diagnosis of Heart Diseases”.He has joined PDA College of Engineering, Kalaburagi as lecturer in 1990, promoted as Senior Grade Lecturer in 1999, promoted as Asst. Professor in 2004, then promoted as Associate professor in 2007. After completion of Ph.D, Prof. Bhairi is promoted as Professor in the year 2015. He is engaged in UG level teaching for 27 years and 13 year in PG course. He has worked as BOS member, BOS chairman and BOE member. His efforts contributed in syllabus framing, guiding student projects. Worked as PG course coordinator, coordinator for PDA autonomous exams, working as additional controller of exams. He has played major role in setting up biomedical lab and Virtual Instrumentation lab and establishing research center and it is recognized by VTU, Belagavi. Currently he is guiding 7 research scholars for the award of Ph.D. Worked as Chair Person in National Conference held at BKIT, Bhalki. Worked as Reviewer for ICCRAES 2017 International Conference. Working as Addl. Controller of Examinations. Appointed as External Doctoral Committee member for BKIT, Bhalki. Worked as Advisory committee member for National conference NCRAET-2017 held at BEC, Basavakalyan.

Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering department has VTU recognized Research Center. It is equipped with all the research facilities.
Faculty of the department have published many research papers in international and national journals. Quite good number of papers are presented in national and international conferences.

Along with all the basic laboratories, department has a well equipped Process Instrumentation laboratory and Biomedical Laboratory. Ours is the first institute in North Karnataka to establish Virtual Instrumentation laboratory and conduct training for the students.
Department also has a independent library with 500 books and computing facility with internet connectivity

Every year both UG and PG students publish papers in National and International conferences journals. One of our student Shreya Hiremath’s Project has been selected by New Age Incubation Network and has been funded with Rs. 3 lakhs. Our student projects are regularly being selected by KSCST, Bangalore.
Department has a students Association by name ‘Tachyon Association’ which regularly conducts co-curricular and extracurricular activities for the students.
